header.title: #op2012: An Invocation of the Egregore of Anonymous

central_thesis: The central thesis is that collective belief energy, specifically that generated by the 2012 Mayan calendar 'apocalypse' meme, can be magically hijacked and redirected by an individual practitioner to empower and manifest socio-political memes of anarchism, independence, and hacktivism, as embodied by the Anonymous and Occupy movements, through the invocation of their collective egregore.

structure_content.summary: This section introduces the ritual's purpose: to leverage the concentrated belief energy surrounding the 2012 Mayan calendar end-date. The author's goal is to divert this energy from a destructive 'apocalypse' meme towards constructive 'anarchism and independence' memes, particularly those associated with Anonymous and Occupy, using themselves as a conduit to invoke an egregore and charge common ideas.

The practitioner details the meticulous physical and energetic cleansing of the ritual space using smudging. Symbolic items are arranged in a multi-layered circle: eight books at cardinal points representing modern magic, hope, the union of science/magic, and chaos/personal power; four additional books for sympathetic links. Major Arcana Tarot cards (Mage, Lovers, Tower, Strength) are placed with lockpicks and coins (gold for existing systems, silver for labor) to represent specific magical qualities and intentions. The practitioner adopts the Guy Fawkes mask and black suit 'uniform' of Anonymous for identity immersion.

The ritual commences with a traditional Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram (LBRP). Incense is burned, and a recording of Anonymous numbers stations plays continuously. The practitioner chants Anonymous mottos ('We are Anonymous. We are legion. We do not forgive. We do not forget. Expect us.') to achieve a state of gnosis, enabling connection to the 'Anonymous hive-mind.' An extemporaneous invocation of Anonymous, followed by a 'paen' to Eris, aims to project warnings and suggestions to the collective consciousness.

During gnosis, the practitioner experiences a vivid vision: seeing Earth covered in black 'Anonymous' pixels, then a black sphere wearing a Guy Fawkes mask. A golden apple (from Eris) bursts into golden sparkles, which are snatched by the 'Anonymous suits' to blast away 'shadows and decay.' This leads to a vision of 'Black Iron Prisons' collapsing, their wreckage repurposed into new, decentralized structures. The vision concludes with an 'Anon-figure' planting a red-and-black flag, symbolizing the release and programming of the ritual's raised energy through the charged rod.

structure_content.chapter_title: Post-Ritual Observations and Call to Action
structure_content.summary: The author reflects on the perceived effects, noting increased visibility and effectiveness of Occupy and Anonymous movements. They explicitly invite readers to replicate or adapt the ritual, encouraging its use to foster community activism and assist the underprivileged, emphasizing personal agency and will in bringing about change.

key_concepts.definition: A psychic entity or collective thoughtform created by the sustained thoughts, beliefs, and emotional energy of a group of people. In this context, the Egregore of Anonymous is invoked as a powerful, autonomous entity representing the collective will and intent of the hacktivist group.

The practice of using collective cultural ideas, symbols, or catchphrases (memes) as vehicles for magical energy and intent. The author specifically refers to hijacking the 'energy focused on this exact date and time by professional paranoids, doomsayers' (the Mayan calendar meme) and redirecting it towards socio-political 'memes of anarchism and independence'.

An altered state of consciousness, often induced through ritual or repetitive actions (like chanting), wherein the practitioner bypasses ordinary critical thought to directly access and manipulate magical energy or connect with desired entities/concepts. Here, it is achieved through chanting Anonymous mottos while listening to numbers stations.

A fundamental principle of magic stating that 'energy flows where attention goes.' The ritual aims to subvert and redirect this flow from a widely attended, yet undirected, meme (2012 apocalypse) to specific, actionable memes (Anonymous, Occupy) to effect real-world change.

A conceptual collective consciousness or shared mental network attributed to the decentralized Anonymous collective. The practitioner seeks to connect with this 'hive-mind' during gnosis to send 'instructions or plant suggestions' for social action.

practical_system.description: The system presented is an operative Chaos Magic ritual designed to re-direct large-scale collective belief energy. It involves identifying a powerful, widespread 'meme' (e.g., the 2012 Mayan calendar 'apocalypse'), and a target 'meme complex' (e.g., anarchism, Anonymous, Occupy). The practitioner acts as a temporary conduit, performing a multi-stage ritual to cleanse the space, set symbolic intent through objects (books, Tarot cards, lockpicks, coins), immerse in the target egregore's identity (Guy Fawkes mask, chanting mottos), achieve gnosis, and then direct the harvested energy through visionary experience and programmed intent towards the desired social change. The core mechanic relies on the principle that 'energy flows where attention goes' and can be subverted for different, related ends.
tools: Crimethinc poster (or red and black flag).

Specific books: 'Geneation Hex', '21st Century Mage', 'Pronoia', 'Making Things Talk', 'Gathering the Magic', 'Where Science and Magic Meet', 'Principia Discordia', 'Seizing Power', 'How to Own A Continent', 'Mass Control: Engineering Human Consciousness', 'Hacking: The Art of Exploitation', 'Archaic Revival'.
Tarot deck (specifically The Mage, The Lovers, The Tower, Strength Major Arcana).
Anonymous 'uniform': Black suit, white shirt, black necktie, black shoes, plastic Guy Fawkes mask.
Laptop with Anonymous numbers station recordings.
White pin (personal, entangled with colleague's badge).
rituals: Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram (LBRP) for clearing ritual space (twice, once at start, once at end).
Smudging with cinnamon incense and feather fan for purification.
Arrangement of symbolic books in inner and outer rings at cardinal/intercardinal points.
Placement of Major Arcana Tarot cards (Mage, Lovers, Tower, Strength) at cardinal points with lockpicks and coins.
Donning the Anonymous 'uniform' (Guy Fawkes mask, black suit, etc.).
Playing Anonymous numbers station recordings as a hypnotic/gnosis-inducing element.
Chanting Anonymous mottos ('We are Anonymous...', 'Expect us.') to enter gnosis and connect to the hive-mind.
Extemporaneous invocation of Anonymous and the goddess Eris to broadcast intent.
Charging a personal ritual rod and Tarot cards, then releasing programmed energy through a visionary act (golden apple, collapsing 'Black Iron Prisons').

relevant_quotes.text: On 21 December 2012... let's be honest, one magickian got it in zir head to take advantage of the weight of belief behind the end of the Mayan calendar.

My intent was to channel the energy away from the 21 December 2012 meme into the memes of anarchism and independence, most recently represented by Anonymous, other hacktivist groups around the planetÂ³, and the different incarnations of Occupy... by invoking an egregore, charging representations of some ideas that these meme complexes have in common, and then pulling the energy from one meme complex into the other using myself as a temporary conduit.
Change will only come from individuals taking action.
Chaos doesn't work well with force, better with finesse.
We are Anonymous. We are legion. We do not forgive. We do not forget. Expect us.
The system has become corrupt, and will be dismantled from within.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant to contemporary Western Esotericism and Occultism, particularly Chaos Magic, as it demonstrates a practical application of magical theory to modern socio-political activism. It contextualizes traditional magical concepts like egregores and energy manipulation within a framework of internet memes and decentralized movements. It explores the 'operative' side of magic, moving beyond personal transformation to attempt collective societal influence, showcasing how practitioners engage with current events and popular culture as magical phenomena. The 'fuck you' copyright disclaimer further cements its counter-cultural, anarchic spirit within the occult context.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of practitioners of Chaos Magic, radical occultists, anarchists interested in magical theory and practice, and individuals seeking to integrate magic with social and political activism. It presumes familiarity with basic ritual magic concepts (e.g., LBRP, gnosis) and an interest in applying these to real-world socio-political change rather than solely personal development.
